column2: Sergio Bresciani, known as the hero child, was one of the youngest recepients of the Medaglia d'Oro. He had tried to join the army several times from age 15 and eventually succeeded at age 17. He earned the admiration and respect of the Italian military and Rommel, who personally decorated him with the Iron Cross Second Class after Operation Battleaxe. During the Second Battle of El Alamein, Bresciani was personally involved in the destruction of some twenty Allied tanks. He died in September 1942 after his truck hit a mine, and was posthumously decorated with the Iron Cross First Class.

This year's edition of the Istres Parigi Damasco (an aeronautical endurance competition featuring a 6190km race) was won by an italian team led by Cupini flying an SM79 carrying the colours of the Sorci Verdi.

1939 saw over 7000 Italians coming back to Italy from the foreign countries where they had emigrated. Of those, 4749 came from continental France and Corsica, and 1340 from Tunisia. Many also came from Morocco and Monaco. Those people were put into special piani di avviamento (start up plans) in Albania, Libya and Abyssinia, where the State provided land, housing, financial support and agricultural equipment.
